Nurse: Great, Mr. Valenzuela. You don't have to do anything just yet. But you'll need to start your bowel prep 24 hours before your procedure by drinking only clear liquids. This involves no solid foods and drinking either clear or light colored beverages without any red or purple dye. Can I share some examples of what clear liquids are?

Patient: Yes, please. Yes.

Nurse: Of course, Mr. Valenzuela. Clear liquids include water, green tea, clear broth, light colored sports drinks, and jello or other gelatin without fruit or red color. Do you have any questions about these examples or any other clear liquids you're curious about?

Patient: It's pretty forward.

Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. Valenzuela. It's essential to stay hydrated during this time, so please make sure to drink plenty of clear liquids. Do you have any remaining questions about the diet changes?

Patient: No. I it's all temporary, so I think I'm gonna be okay.

Nurse: That's the right attitude, Mr. Valenzuela. It's indeed temporary and a crucial part of the procedure. The other main step to remember is drinking the laxative solution the night before your procedure. You'll need to start drinking the first half of your PLENVU laxative solution around 6PM. And then wake up early the morning of the procedure to finish drinking the second half of the solution. Would you like some tips on making the bowel prep easier?

Patient: Yes. What are the tips?
